page.title: 09POPULATION/ARMED FORCES
page.content:
The{population}of the borough of Haddington has risen by approximately {3000}from{1881}to{1981,}when it was {7839.}Reasons for this increase are the{Glasgow overspill}and the attraction of this area as a{commuter {belt}around Edinburgh. It is probable that over the next few years there will again be a definite{rise}in the population. Quick and easy access to Edinburgh via the newly built {Musselburgh and Tranent by-pass}will mean that more commuters to the city will be settling in the new housing schemes in Haddington.
{ARMED FORCES}: The Royal Scots Regiment has the freedom of Haddington.
